messages.content: At this election, the Tories want you to forget what they’ve done to Wales in the past. They want you to forget the industries they destroyed, they want you to forget the communities they trampled over, and they want you to forget the livelihoods they damaged so badly. More than that, the Tories want you to think they’ve changed. They want you to think despite the horrors successive Tory governments have visited on Wales, that this time it will be different.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Here in Wales, despite a Welsh Labour Government protecting and investing in our communities and our public services, there are too many who still bear the scars of the Tories' terrible legacy in Wales.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only a vote for Welsh Labour can help keep the Tories out.

issues.economy: If the Tories win a thumping majority in Westminster the money coming to Wales will be slashed further still.
issues.governance: Now more than ever, we must stand shoulder to shoulder to protect what we hold most dear and do all we can to stop the Tories from destroying what we have worked so hard together to build.
issues.labourEmployment: I am determined that my Welsh Labour Government will continue protecting and investing in the jobs, homes and opportunities that people here need and deserve.

examples: They've already snatched £1bn from our public services, and we know that given the chance they will take more still.
They want you to forget the industries they destroyed, they want you to forget the communities they trampled over, and they want you to forget the livelihoods they damaged so badly.
As history tells us, the Tories have never cared about Wales.
protecting and investing in our communities
we must stand shoulder to shoulder to protect what we hold most dear
If the Tories win a thumping majority in Westminster the money coming to Wales will be slashed further still.
At this election, the Tories want you to forget what they’ve done to Wales in the past.
More than that, the Tories want you to think they’ve changed.
They want you to think despite the horrors successive Tory governments have visited on Wales, that this time it will be different.
